title: After BMC setback, Raj Thackeray meets Eknath Shinde amid MNS unease
content: Maharashtra Navnirman Sena chief Raj Thackeray met Deputy Chief Minister Eknath Shinde in Mumbai, marking their first interaction since the BMC elections. The meeting, which covered various issues, follows MNS's support for Shinde's Shiv Sena in Kalyan-Dombivli and Shinde's praise for Thackeray's broader perspective in decision-making.

title: Sit, stay, run: Dog gatecrashes Olympic sprint, crosses finish line - watch
content: A surprise guest stole the show at the Milan-Cortina Winter Games. An unregistered dog dashed onto the cross-country ski course during the women's team free sprint. The enthusiastic canine chased competitors, even crossing the finish line. Officials eventually intervened, escorting the four-legged interloper off the piste. His unscheduled Olympic bid ended abruptly.

title: More trouble for Galgotias University? After Chinese robodog, Korean soccer drone
content: Galgotias University is under renewed scrutiny at the India AI Impact Summit. Following controversy over a robotic dog, the institution now faces questions about a drone soccer arena. Faculty claimed it as an in-house innovation, but social media users point to similar commercially available products from South Korea. The university was asked to vacate its stall at the summit.

title: Google CEO feels nostalgic to see transition from Digital India to AI Impact Summit
content: Google CEO Sundar Pichai sees India's AI revolution as a "transformational moment," drawing parallels to the Digital India movement. He believes India is uniquely positioned to be a "full-stack player" in AI, excelling as a user base, technology builder, and rule shaper. Pichai emphasized that AI's true success will be measured by its impact on ordinary Indians' daily lives.

title: Sahibzada Farhan: Once made documentary on hitting sixes off Bumrah, now a World Cup centurion
content: Never short of headlines, Sahibzada Farhan completed a full-circle moment with a scintillating T20 World Cup century against Namibia in Colombo. From challenging selection norms and going unsold in the PSL to becoming only Pakistan’s second World Cup centurion. Pakistan defeated Namibia by 102 runs to cement their place in the Super Eight

title: Tech stocks that Warren Buffett sold during his last days as Berkshire CEO
content: Warren Buffett significantly reduced his stakes in major tech companies Amazon and Apple in his final quarter as Berkshire Hathaway CEO. The filings reveal substantial sales of both Amazon and Apple shares, continuing a trend of Berkshire being a net seller of stocks. Buffett also divested a large portion of his Bank of America holdings before his retirement.

title: 'India doesn't negotiate as a meek nation': Piyush Goyal on recent trade deals
content: Piyush Goyal revealed India's ambitious economic diplomacy, emphasising engagement and trust to achieve trade success.  He highlighted the nation's goal of becoming a $30-35 trillion economy by 2047, stressing the need for global integration.  Goyal noted India's recent success in securing trade agreements from a position of strength, while safeguarding national interests.

title: AI boom! What Nvidia wants from India to put New Delhi on the global manufacturing map
content: NVIDIA's Shanker Trivedi urged India to boost AI infrastructure investment beyond $1.2 billion, aligning with global standards. He highlighted the Union Budget's 20-year tax holiday for foreign firms as a significant chance to build foundational AI capacity. With 1,800 global corporations operating in India, each requiring local AI factories, increased capital allocation is crucial for developing intelligence-led business processes.

title: Google AI CEO tells everyone why Gemini & ChatGPT winning International Maths Olympiad is not big
content: Google AI CEO Demis Hassabis stated that AI systems solving complex Maths Olympiad problems do not prove general intelligence. These systems can still err on basic math and are 'frozen' after training. They struggle with long-term strategies and consistency across tasks. Hassabis emphasized the need for AI that learns continuously and plans for the future.

title: Sahibzada Farhan scripts history, becomes only 2nd Pakistan batter to achieve this feat
content: Sahibzada Farhan made history by scoring a century in the T20 World Cup. He is the second Pakistani batter to achieve this milestone. Farhan's century helped Pakistan post a strong total against Namibia. This performance was crucial for Pakistan's hopes of advancing in the tournament. The team made changes to its lineup for this important match.

title: 'Was anxious about her future after my death': Former Isro employee murders wife in Bengaluru flat
content: A former ISRO employee, Nagesh Ishwar Rao, was arrested in Bengaluru for allegedly strangling his wife, Sandhya Shri, to death. Police revealed Rao cited anxieties about his wife's future as his motive. The couple's daughter, residing in the US, has been notified. An investigation into the tragic incident is ongoing.

title: Nandan Nilekani says AI is ending these 4 IT jobs — and creating 5 new roles soon
content: Infosys Chairman Nandan Nilekani declared AI is fundamentally reshaping tech jobs, shifting focus from coding to managing AI agents. This "root-and-branch" transformation demands new skills in AI engineering and orchestration, while roles like front-end developers and QA testers are expected to shrink. Companies face the challenge of reskilling their workforce for these evolving AI-centric roles.

title: Chinese robodog row at AI Impact Summit: Why is Galgotias University under fire? Explained
content: Galgotias University was asked to leave the AI Summit Expo after showcasing a Chinese-made robotic dog as an in-house innovation. The university clarified it did not build the robot but used it to inspire students, sparking a debate on domestic AI development versus global technology adoption.

title: NHL trade news: St. Louis Blues likely to undergo major rebuild
content: The St. Louis Blues are at a crossroads as general manager Doug Armstrong is at a juncture where he has to decide whether to go for a late-season surge or a complete rebuild. The coming month will be very important for the team, as well-placed trades and recall decisions could change the course of their history.

title: Dwarka car accident aftermath video shows brother-sister duo shifting blame on biker
content: New CCTV and mobile footage has emerged from the fatal Dwarka South crash, showing a brother and sister arguing with bystanders after the collision that killed biker Sahil Dhaneshra. The SUV, allegedly driven by a minor, had narrowly avoided a bus before hitting the motorcycle and a stationary car.

title: Traveller shares why some foreigners aren’t big fan of Indian tourists
content: An Indian traveler's experience in Vietnam highlighted how certain Indian tourists' behaviors, like aggressive bargaining and queue-jumping, negatively impacted local perceptions. Similar incidents shared by other Indians abroad underscore a recurring issue of civic sense translating poorly across borders, leading to international stereotypes.

title: Live stream to wall climbs: Bihar Class X board exams open in chaos
content: Bihar School Examination Board exams commenced with significant disruptions. A Facebook Live video from a Siwan exam centre raised security concerns. Students across districts attempted to scale walls to enter centres after arriving late. Incidents of cheating were also reported. Authorities are investigating the breaches and ensuring exam integrity.

title: Why China's Gen Z are choosing to parent stuffed toys over real babies
content: Young Chinese women are embracing "painless parenthood" by raising life-sized cotton dolls, offering nurturing joy without the financial and career burdens of real motherhood. This trend, fueled by fandom and a desire for emotional fulfillment, allows them to experience motherhood's warmth and express creativity in a judgment-free environment, redefining adulthood on their own terms.

title: Four ducks in 7 innings, no problem: Abhishek Sharma remains No. 1 T20I batter
content: Abhishek Sharma holds the top spot in ICC T20I batter rankings despite recent form. Ishan Kishan has entered the top 10 after strong performances. Pathum Nissanka and Ryan Rickelton also saw significant ranking jumps. Saim Ayub is back at number one in the all-rounder rankings. Rashid Khan is closing in on the top bowling spot.

title: Super 8 spot on the line, Pakistan drop Shaheen Afridi for must-win game; here's why
content: Pakistan made a significant change, dropping fast bowler Shaheen Shah Afridi for their must-win T20 World Cup match against Namibia. The team also brought in Salman Mirza and Khawaja Nafay. This decision comes amidst criticism of senior players' recent performances and the team's precarious position in the tournament.

title: Firing at Rohit Shetty's house: 7 held for ‘Hindu Sainik Mission’ to spread fear
content: Rohit Shetty’s Mumbai home was attacked on February 1. Police say the shooting was planned by the Shubham Lonkar gang, who recruited seven youths through social media with promises of money and fame. Two modules, from Pune and North India, handled logistics and execution. Several accused are now under arrest.

title: Ramadan moon sighted? Hilal sighting committees to confirm 1st day of fasting
content: Muslims worldwide eagerly await the Ramadan crescent moon sighting, marking the start of the holy month. This year, fasting is expected to begin on February 18th in Saudi Arabia and the Gulf, while South Asia, Europe, and North America may commence on February 19th due to local sighting variations. The month emphasizes fasting, prayer, reflection, and charity.

title: Pacers exploit conditions as South Africa storm into T20 World Cup Super 8s unbeaten
content: South Africa secured a commanding six-wicket victory over the UAE, boosting their morale heading into the T20 World Cup Super Eight stage. Despite a rain-interrupted start, the Proteas chased down 123 aggressively, with Dewald Brevis and Aiden Markram leading the charge.  Key performances from bowlers Corbin Bosch and Anrich Nortje were crucial in restricting the UAE.

title: Cracks in INDIA bloc? Sena (UBT) backs Mamata or Stalin to lead oppn; cites ‘inner voices’
content: Shiv Sena (UBT) urges the INDIA bloc to strategize collectively before state elections, highlighting internal confusion within Congress.  The party's mouthpiece points to conflicting suggestions for leadership, including Mamata Banerjee and Stalin, questioning the alliance's post-election direction and stressing the need for unified action.

title: Kerala to Canada to T20 World Cup: Joji Varghese’s dream meeting with Sanju Samson
content: A former physical education teacher from Thiruvananthapuram, Joji Varghese, who moved to Canada for his children's future, fulfilled a lifelong dream by meeting his favourite cricketer, Sanju Samson. Now a massage therapist for the Canadian cricket team, Joji shared an emotional reunion with Samson during a practice session in India, highlighting Samson's humility and connection.

title: Rajpal Yadav walks out of jail; press conference planned after niece's wedding
content: Actor Rajpal Yadav has been granted temporary release from Tihar Jail in his cheque bounce case. He plans to address the media soon, stating that all legal matters are before the High Court. Yadav, who paid Rs 1.5 crore to suspend his sentence, is currently busy with his niece's wedding. His last film was 'Bhool Bhulaiyaa 3'.

title: 'Illegal' knives ordered from Blinkit used in murders? Delhi police book quick-commerce platform
content: Delhi Police have launched an FIR under the Arms Act after a quick-commerce platform, Blinkit, was found selling illegal knives.  Following two local murders, police discovered knives exceeding legal blade length and width being sold online.  Raids have since recovered 50 prohibited knives from various locations, with investigations ongoing.

title: ‘Kya karoge jaan ke’: Murdered MBA student’s boyfriend shows no remorse, smirks at reporters
content: Accused in the murder of an MBA student displayed striking indifference during a crime scene reconstruction, brushing aside reporters' questions. Police described his demeanor as unusually calm and detached, noting his claims of wanting to communicate with the victim's spirit and his consumption of occult content.

title: Cigarette stocks light up! ITC, Godfrey Phillips surge up to 12% on price hike reports
content: Cigarette stocks surged on Dalal Street as manufacturers raised prices to offset increased excise duties. ITC, Godfrey Phillips India, and VST Industries saw significant gains following reports of price hikes aimed at protecting margins. This move comes after the government's notification on a new tobacco taxation framework.

title: 'We had to wash dishes ...': Pakistan hockey captain lashes out at PHF
content: Pakistan's hockey captain, Shakeel Ammad Butt, has fiercely criticised the Pakistan Hockey Federation following a disastrous tour of Australia. Players endured severe accommodation issues, including being forced to wash dishes before matches, and faced significant delays and unconfirmed bookings. Butt stated the team's performance was negatively impacted by these embarrassing circumstances.

title: 'Chinese products showcased': Rahul Gandhi calls AI Impact summit 'disorganised PR spectacle'
content: Rahul Gandhi criticized the AI Impact Summit as a "disorganized PR spectacle," alleging Indian data is being sold while Chinese products are showcased. The Congress party echoed this sentiment, calling the event embarrassing and damaging to India's global image.

title: MLBPA head Clark resigns after internal inquiry
content: MLBPA executive director Tony Clark has resigned after an internal investigation revealed an inappropriate relationship with his sister-in-law, who was hired by the union in 2023, sources told ESPN.

title: Texas Tech upset by ASU as Toppin exits with injury
content: Texas Tech star forward JT Toppin injured his lower right leg while driving to the basket with 6:03 remaining in Tuesday night's upset loss at Arizona State.

title: Vini Jr. accuses 'coward' Prestianni of racist abuse
content: Real Madrid forward Vinícius Júnior accused Benfica's Gianluca Prestianni of racially abusing him during the teams' Champions League playoff first leg on Tuesday.

title: UCLA's Cronin ejects own player after flagrant foul
content: UCLA coach Mick Cronin sent Bruins center Steven Jamerson II to the locker room after he fouled Carson Cooper from behind on a dunk attempt late in Tuesday night's blowout loss to Michigan State.

title: Klaebo joins Phelps as only 10-gold Olympians
content: Norway's Johannes Hoesflot Klaebo has won a 10th gold medal in cross country skiing, putting him in an exclusive group with swimming great Michael Phelps.

title: Agent: WR Evans plans to continue playing in '26
content: Wide receiver Mike Evans, the Buccaneers' all-time leading scorer, will play a 13th season in 2026 with the destination to be determined, his agent, Deryk Gilmore, told ESPN.

title: QB Rashada's suit vs. Napier, UF booster settled
content: A settlement was reached in the lawsuit filed by journeyman quarterback Jaden Rashada against former Florida football coach Billy Napier and a school booster over a failed NIL deal.

title: Union counters; WNBA calls proposal 'unrealistic'
content: The WNBA players' union submitted a counterproposal to the league Tuesday that included some concessions on revenue sharing and housing, sources told ESPN.

title: 2026 Winter Olympics: Shiffrin leads after first run, U.S. men's hockey begins knockout round and more
content: Wednesday at the Winter Olympics is headlined by Mikaela Shiffrin in the slalom and U.S. men's hockey beginning the knockout stage.

title: Faces who need new places: We picked 32 players who could use fresh starts with new teams
content: Let's pick out players who could use a change of scenery for the 2026 season, including David Montgomery, Anthony Richardson and L'Jarius Sneed.

title: Three A's, a whole lot of B's and one F -- but who got them? Final MLB offseason grades for all 30 teams
content: Now that spring training and preparation for the 2026 season are underway, let's hand out offseason report cards for every club.

title: Women's Bracketology: Will Stanford miss the NCAA tournament again?
content: Teams with a high NET ranking are typically NCAA tournament locks. So why are the Huskers in the Last Four In?

title: How NHL GMs are handling the Olympic break
content: We spoke to execs around the league to learn what they're up to while many players are in Milan Cortina.

title: NBA regular-season viewers guide: Biggest storylines, matchups and awards races
content: Biggest storylines, matchups and award races to watch in the last two months of the 2025-26 NBA regular season.

title: The 2026 Jalens vs. the World: We ranked the 11 best seasons of identical first names
content: Could the current Jalens (and Jaylens, Jaylins and Jaylons) beat other all-time greats if they teamed up?

title: How the sports memorabilia industry tries to stay ahead of fraud
content: Sports memorabilia and collectibles companies are monitoring for fraudsters and shifting authentication tactics.

title: The Bilas Index: Ranking the top 68 teams in men's college basketball
content: With a month until Selection Sunday, Bilas reveals which teams he has at the top of the pecking order.

title: Which 2027 college football recruits will fit best at their next school?
content: Looking ahead to the next recruiting class, there are big commits poised for big things at the next level.

title: Shiffrin aims for Olympic gold in slalom -- and this time, she's the favorite
content: Mikaela Shiffrin was not expected to medal in Sunday's giant slalom. On Wednesday, she's the front-runner to win gold in slalom.

title: USA vs. Canada is the women's hockey rematch everyone was waiting for
content: How did both teams get here? Who are the players to watch? We break down some of the storylines as the two powers in women's hockey are set to go head-to-head for gold.

title: Champions League recap: Vinicius leads Madrid to win vs. Benfica, PSG with comeback
content: Enjoy all that happened from today's knockout phase playoff first legs, including Benfica vs. Real Madrid and AS Monaco vs. Paris Saint-Germain.

title: A night of extreme highs and lows as Real Madrid learn Benfica lessons
content: Vinícius Júnior's stunning 50th-minute winner was followed by a 10-minute stoppage when the Real Madrid winger accused Benfica's Gianluca Prestianni of racially abusing him and the referee invoked UEFA's anti-racism protocol.

title: NBA Finals odds: Thunder, Nuggets still big favorites, Cavs volatile after Harden trade
content: The Cavs' title odds improved with the trade for James Harden, but the Thunder and Nuggets are clear favorites.

title: Paul, Shields, more react to Ronda Rousey vs. Gina Carano
content: Ronda Rousey and Gina Carano have returned to MMA, and the two will fight on Netflix in May. Here are the top reactions from social media.

title: Rousey vs. Carano is a sign of the times -- with a silver lining
content: Ronda Rousey vs. Gina Carano is an opportunity for two pioneers of women's MMA to have a night in the spotlight they created.

title: College baseball Week 1: Top 25 rankings, play of the week and what to watch
content: With upsets of top teams and electric plays across the whole sport, how did the top 25 rankings shake out?

title: F1 testing LIVE: Lewis Hamilton driving after fast Ferrari start to second test, Aston Martin struggle
content: Follow live updates and analysis of the second week of Formula 1's preseason test in Bahrain as the 2026 cars take to the track.

title: Meet Noahkai Banks, 19, the outside pick to make USMNT's World Cup squad
content: Noahkai Banks' strong form for Augsburg in the Bundesliga might not just get him in Mauricio Pochettino's USMNT squad for the World Cup -- he might even be a starter.

title: Transfer rumors, news: PSG, Liverpool join race for Villa star Rogers
content: Paris Saint-Germain and Liverpool have joined the race to sign Aston Villa attacking midfielder Morgan Rogers. Transfer Talk has the latest.

title: Lapsed fan guide: Dodgers rule, offseason moves, trades, more
content: Everything you need to know about the 2026 season for the fan who has been away and is looking to dive back in.

title: Fantasy draft guide: Rankings, tips, strategy, stats and more
content: All the rankings, projections, cheat sheets, strategy and analysis you need for the 2026 fantasy baseball season.

title: 95-year-old unable to travel, Patna court goes to his house
content: a judge delivered the verdict in a 15-year-old bank fraud case . he pleaded for amnesty after imposing a fine of Rs 2,000 on him . the judge held him guilty, and disposed of the case after imposeing a 2,000 fine .

title: Twins from Odisha bag identical score in JEE Main
content: the twins studied together, tested together, walked away with identical marks till the last digit . they sat the same JEE Main (Session-I) 2026 shift . under NTA rules, candidates must declare if they are twins while filling out forms .

title: Why Lord Shiva wears serpent king ‘Vasuki’ around his neck

title: Govt. approves 601.40 acres of land for Google data centre in Vizag
content: Against the initial allotment of 480 acres at three locations in Visakhapatnam and Anakapalli districts, the data centre has now been allotted 266.60 acres at Tarluvada, 160 acres at Adavivaram & Mudasarlova, and 174.80 acres at Rambilli following a request from Raiden Infotech India Pvt. Ltd., a subsidiary of Google

title: Kerala Cabinet nod for Kerala Nativity Card Bill
content: The Nativity Card is modelled on the existing Nativity Certificate issued by the State government to certify that a person is a Keralite. The card will be accepted as an authoritative document for services provided by the State government and other social requirements,

title: Stop ‘Hindu certificates’ to politicians, Gogoi tells Assam CM
content: The State Congress president said that his predecessor, Bhupen Kumar Borah’s decision to join the BJP has exposed his long-rumoured proximity to Himanta Biswa Sarma

title: Nepotism, self-aggrandisement anathema to democratic system: Supreme Court
content: A Bench of Justices Sanjay Kumar and K. Vinod Chandran set aside an order of the Punjab and Haryana High Court which had refused to intervene in the allotment process

title: DMK failed to solve basic problems plaguing agricultural sector:  Farmers federation
content: None of the election promises of DMK given in 2021 with regard to irrigation projects hav been fulfilled, says Vaigai Kiruthumal Gundar Irrigation Farmers’ Federation general secretary

title: PM Modi meets Google CEO, discusses AI collaborations
content: Talked about the work India is doing in AI and how Google can work with our talented students and professionals in this field,” PM Modi said on X

title: Over 1.70 lakh illegal foreigners detected under Assam Accord in 40 years: Minister
content: The Minister said that as per provision of the Accord, 1,37,152 illegal immigrants who entered the State post-1971 till December 31, 2025, and another 33,485 who came between 1966 and 1971 have been identified and declared as foreigners

title: NIA nabs man from Kochi airport for links with PFI
content: Malappuram native has been absconding for the past three years after being booked in a case involving ‘arms training’

title: Only motive of conducting Special Revision in Assam is to include eligible and exclude ineligible voters: CEC
content: Addressing a press conference at the end of the 3-day visit to review poll preparedness in Assam, Gyanesh Kumar said the SR was conducted in Assam as it is the only State where the NRC is almost complete

title: Structural failures continue to plague NH 66 in Kollam
content: Residents say concrete panels are cracking and shifting under the weight of construction machinery at Kottiyam and Parakkulam

title: Bhupen Borah’s resignation exposes rift in Assam Congress, Priyanka to step in
content: Bhupen Borah, a two-time legislator who headed the State unit from 2021 to 2025, announced his resignation citing “self-respect” and dissatisfaction with organisational decisions

title: ISKCON playing key role in serving mankind: Shah in Mayapur
content: The Home Minister says ISKCON is playing a key role in carrying the flag of ‘Sanatan Dharma’ across the world.

title: Tamil Nadu Assembly session: Ruling party, AIADMK spar over credit for establishing medical colleges
content: Assembly also witnesses heated debate over distribution of free laptops to students and functioning of Amma Unavagams

title: Reclaiming educational federalism is a constitutional necessity, says high-level panel on Union-State relations
content: Report says Governors of States should be divested of their role of Chancellors of State universities; recommends that education be shifted to the State List

title: ECI officials flouting Supreme Court directives, issuing instructions on WhatsApp, alleges TMC's Abhishek
content: Even more disturbing are credible reports of Special Roll Observer, C. Murugan, issuing instructions regarding the acceptability of birth certificates directly to Micro Observers in a WhatsApp group, to inflate deletion numbers, says TMC leader Abhishek Banerjee

title: Decision on agreed 18% U.S. tariffs expected within ‘3–4 days’, sources say
content: U.S. President Donald Trump reduced India’s tariff from 50% to 25% effective February 7. The reduction of the remaining 25% reciprocal tariffs to 18% is pending

title: Maharashtra Congress chief Harshwardhan Sapkal apologises to followers of Chhatrapati Shivaji
content: The Congress leader, facing criticism in the run-up to Shivaji Jayanti, says his remarks had been misrepresented

title: Orthodox Church slams Kerala govt. decision to extend operating hours of bars
content: The move will destroy an entire generation, says association secretary of the Malankara Orthodox Syrian Church

title: Death of newborn: doctor suspended following protests
content: Family alleges that delay in conducting C-section led to the baby’s death. Expert team asked to look into issue and submit report on Wednesday itself. Doctors’ association objects to the ‘trial by mob and media’ and is observing a district-wide protest

title: Kerala govt to regularise 20,000 aided school teachers pending SC verdict
content: All benefits due to them from date of appointment will be ensured, says Education Minister V. Sivankutty

title: Collective releases Tamil Nadu Health Manifesto ahead of 2026 Assembly polls
content: The document is the outcome of consultations held with community groups, civil society organisations, and health workers across the State, articulating people’s demands on strengthening the public health system

title: Those who lack intelligence shouldn’t post about AI: BJP on Rahul Gandhi’s AI Summit remark
content: Congress leader attacks the government, describing the ongoing AI Summit as a “disorganised PR spectacle” and alleging that Chinese products are being showcased there.

title: Can't say when I'll return to India; legally barred from leaving U.K.: Mallya to Bombay HC
content: He said he did not have an active passport after it was revoked and hence, he cannot give a definite date of return to India

title: Woman branded witch; burnt alive along with one-year-old child in Jharkhand
content: The woman’s husband, who sustained burn injuries, said a dozen villagers called them out of their house at night, poured kerosene on his wife and child and set them on fire

title: India eases curbs on Chinese equipment imports for power, coal as projects delayed: sources
content: The exemption was granted in the “national interest,” as blocking Chinese imports would hurt India’s manufacturing capability, one of the officials ‌said

title: Kerala teachers’ body seeks withdrawal of order appointing principals as daytime ‘watchmen’ for question papers
content: Aided Higher Secondary Teachers’ Association says school principals, who also assume the charge of chief superintendents, will be forced to come to schools even on Sundays

title: T.N. govt. defers Union Road Ministry’s notification on fee enhancement by three months
content: The Union Ministry for Road Transport and Highways on November 11, 2025, issued a notification enhancing the fee for conducting test/certificate fee for grant or renewal of certificate of fitness for transport vehicles

title: Kerala generates 596 million litres per day of untreated urban sewage
content: Kerala has set up STP projects for treatment of 435.83 MLD. Remaining urban sewage of 596.17 MLD is currently treated through various onsite facilities, says report by Local Self-Government dept submitted before NGT

title: Need to maintain balance between innovation, regulation: Ashwini Vaishnaw
content: Manash Pratim Gohain is a seasoned journalist with over two decades at The Times of India, where he has built a rich body of work spanning education policy, politics, and governance. Renowned for his incisive coverage of the National Education Policy (NEP) 2020, accreditation reforms, and skilling initiatives, he has also reported on student politics, urban policy, and social movements. His political reportage—both reflective and news-driven—adds depth to his writing, bridging policy with public impact. Through his 2,500 articles and related outlets, he has emerged as a trusted voice in national discourse, particularly in linking education reform to broader societal change. title: The Hormuz Threat: Iran's Most Powerful Card Against The US
content: Two American carrier strike groups are now positioned within operational reach of Iran. One, the USS Abraham Lincoln, has been tracked roughly 700 kilometres from the Iranian coastline.

title: India Is Central To The Future Of AI Innovation: Former US AI Advisor Krystle Veda Kaul
content: At a time when artificial intelligence is rapidly reshaping geopolitics, defence, and global commerce, the scale and ambition of India's AI Impact Summit in New Delhi has sent a strong signal to the world.

title: "Chernobyl-Scale Disaster" Warning In AI Guru Stuart Russell's Note To World
content: The world does not have an answer yet to what would happen to humanity if machines start 'thinking', UC Berkeley professor Stuart Russell said at the NDTV Ind.AI Summit today.

title: Odisha Woman Fights Off Bear With Axe To Save Husband
content: Malde Soren and his wife, Lili Soren, had ventured into the forest to collect leaves when they suddenly encountered a group of six wild bears.

title: Galgotias Apologises After Robot Row, Says Rep Neha Singh "Ill-Informed"
content: Greater Noida-based Galgotias University has issued a public apology, blaming one of its own staff members for falsely presenting a Chinese-made robotic dog as an in-house innovation at a major government-backed AI summit.

title: "Representative Was Ill Informed": Galgotias Apologises Over Chinese Robot Dog Row
content: A row has erupted at the India AI Impact Summit 2026, after Galgotias University showcased 'Orion', a Chinese-made robotic dog as a product developed by the its Centre of Excellence.

title: Sarpanch From AAP Shot Dead At Wedding In Punjab's Tarn Taran
content: A sarpanch from a village in Punjab's Tarn Taran, belonging to the ruling Aam Aadmi Party, was shot dead by two unidentified assailants during a wedding.

title: Civic Poll Verdict Seen As Acid Test For Revanth Reddy Government
content: Two days after the results of the Telangana local body elections were declared, the political temperature in the state remains high.

title: India Will Have "Extraordinary Trajectory" With AI: Google CEO Sundar Pichai
content: Pointing out that there is a very high adoption of, and optimism for, AI technologies in India, Pichai said they present a chance for the country to "leapfrog age-old gaps" and create new opportunities.

title: "If I Can Keep Up In Family Dinners, I Can Handle Summits": Rishi Sunak At NDTV AI Summit
content: Rishi Sunak, former Prime Minister of the United Kingdom, spoke at length on India's potential in the field of artificial intelligence or AI, saying the country is "well positioned to take a leadership role".

title: Madhya Pradesh Bets On 'Dwarka', 'Yashoda' Schemes In Rs 4.38 Lakh Crore Budget
content: Madhya Pradesh's Rs 4,38,317 crore budget for 2026-27 has ignited sharp political debate, as the Mohan Yadav government unveiled a welfare-heavy financial plan layered with strong religious symbolism and ambitious spending commitments.

title: "What'll You Do?" Man's Unsettling Calm After Raping, Killing MBA Girlfriend
content: The cameras were already rolling when Piyush Dhamnotiya stepped into view. He did not attempt to hide his face. He did not lower his voice. Instead, he smiled faintly and spoke in a tone that was unsettlingly calm.

title: Vijay Mallya's India Return Uncertain Due To Travel Curbs, Lawyer Tells Court
content: Vijay Mallya informed the Bombay High Court that he is presently not in a position to specify when he can return to India, citing legal constraints arising from proceedings in the UK.

title: CA Slit Throat Of Pregnant Banker Wife With Scissors. She Was Already Dead
content: Anshul was arrested for the murder of his pregnant wife, a 27-year-old employee of HDFC Bank in Gurugram, after the couple had been married for only five months.

title: "Ejaculating Without Penetration Isn't Rape": Chhattisgarh High Court
content: The Chhattisgarh High Court has reduced the sentence of the accused from seven years to three and a half years after medical evidence indicated that the survivor's hymen was intact.

title: Opinion: Opinion | India's Northeast Has A New Problem - 'Jamaat' Surge Along Bangladesh Border
content: Most of Jamaat's victories have come from the north-west and south-west regions adjoining Indian states such as West Bengal, Assam and Meghalaya.

title: "20 Times More Spent On AI Than Entire Manhattan Project": Rishi Sunak
content: The scale of AI's runaway growth is such that companies are investing 20 times more than the entire Manhattan Project, former British prime minister Rishi Sunak told NDTV Editor-in-Chief Rahul Kanwal at the NDTV India.AI Summit today.

title: Rohit Pawar Seeks Minister's Resignation Over Crash That Killed Ajit Pawar
content: Rohit Pawar, MLA and veteran politician Sharad Pawar's grandnephew, has demanded the resignation of Union Civil Aviation Minister K Ram Mohan Naidu and an independent probe into the plane crash that killed his uncle Ajit Pawar

title: A Manchester Dream Cut Short In Delhi: The Life And Loss Of Sahil Dhaneshra
content: In a few months from now, he was set to fly to his dream college in Manchester. A horrific road accident in Delhi snatched it all away.

title: 22-Year-Old Sikh Nurse Hit, Called "Indian Dog" In Australian Gym
content: A nurse was allegedly traumatised after a racially motivated assault in a gym in an Australian city. While leaving the gym, 22-year-old Harman Preet Singh was harassed by three men in Corio, a suburb in Geelong.

title: Extra two fuel tanks on Ajit Pawar’s plane, says Rohit Pawar; demands setting up of monitoring committee
content: The NCP (SP) MLA further raised concerns over the whereabouts of VSR Venture’s owner, V.K. Singh, and his son, Rohit Singh, who is in Miami following the crash

title: From automated farm tractors to exam paper grading, AI boosts efficiency for some in India
content: Artificial intelligence is spreading fast across India, and people already use it to work quicker and cheaper

title: How to explore Theyyam season in north Kerala
content: As the Theyyam season reaches its peak, curated experiences run by locals in Kannur and Kasaragod offer travellers a deeper engagement with Kerala’s ritual art, sacred landscapes and centuries-old folklore. Here is how you can participate

title: Kerala’s KEAM 2026 engineering exam to follow Tamil Nadu-model normalisation formula with 50:50 weightage
content: Reform being reintroduced after former model faced strong opposition last year as it was implemented after entrance examinations had been conducted

title: Supreme Court forms committee to guide judges about sensitivity, compassion in judicial work
content: The judgment was triggered over a 2025 order by Allahabad High Court Judge who used explicit language to narrate a sexual assault on a minor girl

title: ED attaches asset linked to Malayalam actor Jayasurya in money laundering case
content: The actor and his wife were questioned by ED last December in a case of alleged cheating of some persons through an ‘online bidding’ application called ‘Save Box’

title: AI to revolutionise science, medicine; societal challenges need global cooperation: DeepMind CEO Demis Hassabis
content: Demis Hassabis said the world is at a "threshold moment", with Artificial General Intelligence potentially on the horizon within the next five to eight years

title: Detailed project report being prepared for six-laning of Salem-Chengapalli stretch of NH 544
content: While the 54-km Chengapalli-Coimbatore stretch has already been widened to six lanes, the remaining 102.5-km stretch up to Salem continues to operate as a four-lane road

title: Kerala extends bar timings till midnight
content: Government issues notice extending operating hours by two hours. With this, bars and beer parlours in Kerala can function from 10 a.m. till midnight

content: The institute will showcase a large number of demonstrations and interactive experiments on astronomy and basic physics, along with films, photographs, and walk-through exhibits about research at IIA and space sciences

title: Biennial polls to 37 Rajya Sabha seats on March 16

title: On the importance of satire
content: Can satire, comedy or a work of art be a threat to national security or defence of the nation? The Supreme Court has consistently held that satire is one of the most effective art forms revealing the absurdities, hypocrisies and contradictions of life

title: All 20 uniform sets for the 2026 World Baseball Classic, from Japan to Team USA
content: The World Baseball Classic is back this spring -- and so are new uniforms. Twenty teams from across the globe will vie for the title this March, with the game's biggest stars set to represent their respective nations.  Shohei Ohtani  will trade the  Los Angeles Dodgers ' customary blue for the colors of Japan, while  Aaron Judge  will swap the  New York Yankees ' iconic pinstripes for Team USA's red, white and blue. Each nation will have a white home jersey as well as an away jersey of a solid base color. Here's a complete roundup of each squad's look for the tournament.
